stories.text:
I'm currently living in Moscow. It looks like the government will soon very heavily crack down on any uncontrolled ways to get information. This might include blocking of websites, shutdowns of VPNs and outright Internet shutdown.

What can I do to prepare for this and still have access to the Internet? If you have any relevant experience from similar situations, please share!
stories.title: Ask HN: As someone living in Russia, how can I prepare for Internet shutdowns?

stories.text:
JetBrain is company registered in Prague, Czech, however it was created by three Russian developers and currently is hiring a lot of people for their Russian offices[1]. There was also some allegation of malware being embedded in their tools[2].

In the light of recent development is it safe to assume that JetBrain products are not use for Russian espionage?

[1]https://www.jetbrains.com/careers/jobs/

[2]https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/06/us/politics/russia-cyber-hack.html
stories.title: Ask HN: Is JetBrains Russian? Is it safe to use?
